title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 November 2011 - XWiki
content:
01:58 <abusenius> has quit  
07:20 <tekzilla> has quit  
07:41 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
08:32 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <vmassol> has quit  
09:53 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <rrodriguez> has quit  
10:06 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
11:01 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
11:58 <abusenius> has quit  
11:58 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:59 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:15 <rrodriguez> has quit  
13:30 <mflorea> has quit  
14:05 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
14:25 <jvdrean> has quit  
14:36 <cjdelisle> has quit  
14:36 <cjdelisle> has joined #xwiki  
14:36 <cjdelisle> is now known as <Guest79894>  
14:40 <Guest79894> has quit  
14:41 <cjdelisl1> has joined #xwiki  
19:17 <nbetcher> has joined #xwiki  
19:19 <nbetcher> Hi there. Anyone have the 'xwiki-enterprise-wiki-3.3-milestone-1.xar' file that is linked on the XWiki site, but 404's?  
19:19 <@sdumitriu> Hm, 404?  
19:19 <@sdumitriu> Checking  
19:20 <@sdumitriu> You can use this for now: http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-ui-all/3.3-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-enterprise-ui-all-3.3-20111119.170035-192.xar  
19:21 <nbetcher> thanks  
19:24 <nbetcher> Any idea when Milestone 2 will be out?  
19:24 <@sdumitriu> Tomorrow  
19:24 <nbetcher> Oh, heh  
19:24 <@sdumitriu> Where "tomorrow" depends on the timezone you're in  
19:24 <@sdumitriu> Might be Tuesday GMT  
19:25 <nbetcher> GMT -6  
19:25 <nbetcher> but no biggie  
19:25 <nbetcher> just was wondering generally... like next week, next month, etc :P  
19:27 <nbetcher> is there a .war snapshot?  
19:29 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
19:29 <@sdumitriu> http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-web/3.3-SNAPSHOT/  
19:30 <nbetcher> thanks... couldn't find it for some reason  
19:30 <@sdumitriu> Thanks for reporting the broken link, fixed it now  
19:30 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rb091e51 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/admin.vm : [misc] Fixed path to the default wiki - http://git.io/RwnBlg  
19:30 <CIA-102> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r472455b / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/extension/repository/internal/DefaultLocalExtensionRepository.java : [misc] Return a truly empty map instead of a map with one empty entry when there are no backward dependencies for a module - http://git.io/kIn-3g  
19:31 <nbetcher> Thanks again :)  
19:31 <nbetcher> We appreciate your product :)  
19:31 <nbetcher> has left #xwiki  
20:13 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
20:59 <nbetcher> has joined #xwiki  
20:59 <vmassol> has quit  
21:08 <nbetcher> I'm needing some help... something is really not working properly. I have a version 2.7 database that I have tried to upgrade to 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3, but everytime I do, I am unable to edit pages... the WYSIWYG editor continuously spins and the source tab is read-only. I've forced migrations - that doesn't help - I've tried upgrading the XAR-based pages and a lot of other stuff. When I try to upgrade the XAR pages, then logout and try to login it continuous  
21:10 <nbetcher> I've checked release notes, installation help for each version, but none of that has fixed my issues  
21:10 <nbetcher> I've made sure the Migrator class is properly listed in the xwiki.cfg  
21:10 <nbetcher> Not sure what else to do  
21:21 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
21:21 <@sdumitriu> nbetcher: Is it only the WYSIWYG editor that doesn't work?  
21:25 <nbetcher> Uh, well, if the 'Source' tab (to edit the source directly) counts as part of the WYSIWYG component, then yes  
22:23 <abusenius> has quit  
22:26 <nbetcher> Tomcat says this when I have permission issues after loading the 3.3 XAR: [http://wiki:8080/xwiki-enterprise-web-3.3-20111119.165914-243/bin/jsx/AnnotationCode/Script?language=en] ERROR o.i.ObservationContextListener - Can't find any begin event corresponding to [class org.xwiki.bridge.event.ActionExecutedEvent (jsx)]  
22:27 <nbetcher> the WYSIWYG issue was happening when I loaded the 3.3 WAR, but didn't upgrade the XAR  
22:31 <nbetcher> Not sure which is more proper... upgrading the XAR or not.  
22:54 <@sdumitriu> nbetcher: Sorry, I was away for a while  
22:55 <@sdumitriu> Did you try clearing the browser cache?  
22:56 <nbetcher> just did... still the same error. The backend shouldn't be producing that error though  
22:57 <@sdumitriu> Did you read http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise31#HWYSIWYGEditorConfiguration  
22:59 <nbetcher> So should I revert my database, then delete XWiki.WysiwygEditorConfigTemplate and XWiki.WysiwygEditorConfig and import it?  
22:59 <nbetcher> Those instructions assume I know how XWiki works :P  
22:59 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
22:59 <nbetcher> How do I use the object editor?  
23:00 <@sdumitriu> If you're logged in as Admin you should have it in the Edit menu  
23:00 <@sdumitriu> If not, you can go to your profile and switch to Advanced user (edit profile preferences)  
23:00 <@sdumitriu> After that you should have the object editor listed in the Edit menu of any page  
23:01 <qwebirc96804> has joined #xwiki  
23:01 <qwebirc96804> hi  
23:02 <qwebirc96804> has quit  
23:02 <nbetcher> So this is after I deploy the 3.3 WAR, but before I import the 3.3 XAR?  
23:02 <nbetcher> or is this as 2.7?  
23:04 <@sdumitriu> Right, between the war and the xar  
23:07 <nbetcher> is the XAR deployed into the database or FS?  
23:07 <nbetcher> I need to know which to revert  
23:08 <@sdumitriu> Database, but the default DB (hsqldb) is on the FS  
23:08 <@sdumitriu> If you're using something else, then in the DB  
23:27 <nbetcher> argh  
23:27 <nbetcher> this is so frustrating  
23:27 <nbetcher> These instructions are so vague :(  
23:28 <@sdumitriu> Sorry nbetcher  
23:28 <@sdumitriu> By the way, you didn't extract the new war over the old one, right?  
23:28 <nbetcher> and the amount of nesting with this stuff is boggling my mind  
23:28 <nbetcher> no, I didn't  
23:28 <nbetcher> Welcome to the InstyMeds Wiki! » XWiki Space » WYSIWYG Editor Configuration Class » WYSIWYG Editor Configuration Template » WYSIWYG Editor Configuration Panel  
23:29 <nbetcher> "remove deprecated properties" how do I know what's deprecated?  
23:30 <@sdumitriu> They should be listed as "deprecated"  
23:30 <nbetcher> And when I am in the WysiwygEditorConfig page, the only options under Edit are: "Wiki, WYSIWYG, Inline Form | Access Rights, Objects, Class"  
23:31 <nbetcher> I click "Objects" and it brings me to some weird page that means nothing to me  
23:31 <nbetcher> nor does it have any deprecated properties  
23:31 <@sdumitriu> Just delete the whole object  
23:31 <nbetcher> delete WysiwygEditorConfig?  
23:34 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
23:34 <nbetcher> and WysiwygEditorConfigTemplate?  
23:35 <nbetcher> ok, I see what I need to do now :P  
23:37 <nbetcher> Although I don't think this will fix my problem  
23:37 <nbetcher> The WYSIWYG issue was happening if I didn't upgrade the XAR. Now that I upgrade the XAR I'm going to have those permission problems  
23:38 <nbetcher> yup: "You are not allowed to view this document or perform this action." when I'm logged in. When I log out everything is accessed fine  
23:40 <nbetcher> and when the permission error is returned, the following shows up a lot in my Tomcat log: [http://wiki:8080/xwiki-enterprise-web-3.3-20111119.165914-243/bin/jsx/AnnotationCode/Script?language=en] ERROR o.i.ObservationContextListener - Can't find any begin event corresponding to [class org.xwiki.bridge.event.ActionExecutedEvent (jsx)]
